content.text: Form Basics: Using the <form> Tag
Forms in HTML allow users to input data that can be submitted to a server for processing...

<form action="/submit-form" method="POST">
  <!-- Form inputs go here -->
</form>
The action attribute specifies where to send the form data, and the method attribute defines how to send it (POST or GET).
Form Inputs: Text Fields and Buttons
Text fields allow users to enter text, and buttons are used to submit the form or reset fields.

<input type="text" name="username" placeholder="Enter your username">
<button type="submit">Submit</button>
In this example, a text input field is created with a placeholder, and a submit button is used to submit the form.
Creating Tables: Using the <table> Tag
Tables in HTML are created using the <table> tag, with rows defined by <tr> and cells by <td> or <th>.

Name Age
John 25
This example creates a simple table with headers 'Name' and 'Age' and one row of data.
Table Attributes and Structure
Tables can have attributes like cellpadding, cellspacing, and border to control spacing and appearance.
Semantic HTML: Meaningful Tags
Semantic elements provide meaning to the content they enclose, aiding accessibility and SEO.
<header>, <nav>, <section>, <article>, <aside>, <footer>, <main>, <figure>, <figcaption>
These tags help structure content semantically, improving how search engines index and display your web pages.
Benefits of Semantic HTML
Using semantic elements enhances website accessibility for users with disabilities and improves search engine ranking.
